text: {"answer":"S","reasoning":"(ii) is incorrect because res judicata in Swiss civil proceedings binds only the parties (and their legal successors), not any interested third person. (iv) is incorrect because Luhmann’s code for the political system is typically “government/opposition” (or governing/not governing), not “power/not power.” The other statements are generally correct (capacity of judgment is assessed in relation to the конкрет transaction; magic formula is customary, not constitutional; default marital property regime is participation in acquired property, not separation of property)."}
